hl.seg: Bakhtawar has dedicated a musical tribute to Benazir.

doc.seg: Bakhtawar has recorded a rap song in the modern music genre that is now posted on You Tube.
The song is five minutes long and portrays Benazir's life in pictures and clips.
The singer is an eighteen year old student from Edinburgh University.
She has a deep interest in singing and poetry.
It is believed that she started singing after being encouraged by her mother, and started doing so only as a hobby.
She paid tribute to her mother, who she called both intelligent and beautiful, and described as always doing everything in her own way.
Talking about the incident of December 27th, she said that her mother was shot at the temple. She died at the age of 54 and left 3 children behind.
The whole nation is seeking direction without her, and she is present in everyone's heart.
Miss Bakhtawar is the second child of Benazir Bhutto after her 20 year old brother, Bilawal Bhutto.
She has taken a keen interest in music from the start.

Its believed that before her mother's return to Pakistan, she tried to have a meeting arranged with Grammy Award winning music producer and rapper Sean ""P.Diddy"" Combs through a journalist friend, but this meeting never took place.
Miss Bakhtawar's poetry has been translated and published in some Sindhi newspapers, but this is the first time that her voice can be heard via YouTube.
The workers and followers of Benazir Bhutto have started recording CDs of her song.
Mr. Farhatullah Babar, spokesman of Pakistan Peoples Party, has confirmed that both the song’s poetry and vocals on YouTube are performed by Bakhtawar.

He was speaking on the phone from Islamabad and said that it is a tribute of a grief-stricken daughter to her courageous mother and has been aired by Pakistan Television, the national television network of Pakistan.
He further stated that the Peoples Party has not made any plans to distribute the music CDs by Miss Bakhtawar as of yet.
He said that a few months back, a fake account of the young Bilawal Bhutto Zardari, the chairman of Pakistan Peoples Party, was made on the website of Facebook, but it was later closed down.

hl.seg: Rocket Fire from Lebanon too, and bombing in response.

doc.seg: Israeli Army and Police officials have informed the press that four rockets were launched from Lebanon on to Israeli land, one of which hit the Northern part of Israel in Naharia, which injured two people.
In response to the rockets launched from Lebanon, Israeli tanks bombed Lebanon.
It's not certain that this attack was Hezbollah related or if aggravated Palestinian terrorists are behind this.
The Lebanese government has said that they are also trying to investigate who is behind these rocket attacks.
The reporters of BBC have declared this an entirely volatile and dangerous situation.
According to the Head of the Middle East sector of BBC, Jeremy Button, these rocket attacks have increased the chances of spreading the war.
In the past few days, it is feared that the Investigation in Gaza might extend to the Northern part of Lebanon and also to the Israeli border.
Israeli forces have executed around 60 aerial attacks on the Gaza strip, between Wednesday and Thursday nights.
According to the Israeli army, they targeted the Hamas Police offices, tunnels, weapon stores, rocket launching areas and armed individuals, in these attacks.
Apart from aerial attacks, Gaza was also bombed throughout night, from the Israeli and Bahria tank bases.
Palestinian sources say that a mosque was destroyed in the aerial attacks on Gaza.
According to some unconfirmed sources, Israeli tanks are closing in on the area of Khan Younis, with aerial help from helicopters.
In the last twelve days, around 700 Palestinians have been killed, a majority of them being women and children.
On the other hand, 11 Israeli soldiers have also lost their lives.
Israeli Security Forces have confirmed that a high ranked officer, Amos Gailad, has left for Cairo to discuss about the conditions for a ceasefire.
A member of Hamas is also leaving for Cairo, to have talks with the Egyptian Ambassador.
Also, a member of the Palestinian authority, Mahmood Abbas, will be arriving in Cairo on Friday.
""George the Giant Lobster"" was caught in the sea two weeks earlier.
A seafood company of the city had bought him for 100 dollars.
They immediately starting using the lobster as means of advertisement.
But a group for animal rights, ""PETA"", demanded the lobster's release; now he is in the sea again.
George was caught in a sea in Canada, after which he spent ten days in the tank of ""City Crab and Seafood Company.""
The age of a lobster can usually be determined by its weight.
According to the restaurant manager, Keith Wallanty, the lobster was not meant to be harmed, and was put into the tank only to arouse curiosity with their customers.
According to a member of PETA, Ingrid Newkirk, the decision of the restaurant is admirable and serves as an example to those who only want to keep the animal in a tank or boil them and eat them.

hl.seg: Dera Bugti: Explosion on gas pipe line

doc.seg: According to police officials, the explosion has destroyed a pipeline of an 18 inch diameter on the Loti Gas Field to Pir Koh.
This pipeline was directed towards Sui Plant.
Moreover, the spokesman form the banned 'Baloch Republican Army' has accepted the responsibility for the explosion on behalf of his organization on phone.
Fourth pipeline has been blown up in four days.
An 18"" pipeline was destroyed in Dera Allah Yar on Friday. Its mending was continued until Sunday morning.
General Manager of Sui Southern Gas Company, Mushtaq Siddiqui, told in Quetta that the supply line will restart in the afternoon.
This pipeline arrives to Quetta via Sibbi.

For three days, there have been severe gas shortages in Quetta, Ziarat and their suburbs. Snowfall is continuing and temperatures have dropped below the freezing point, and stoves and heaters are not working.
Also, in the city of Dera Bugti, a motorbike exploded in the animal market, but police report no casulaties.

hl.seg: The President of Israel has summarize the prime minister of Turkey.

doc.seg: Rajab Argan almost shouted at the Israeli president in the Gaza Strip. He said that blood of Muslims have been shed in Gaza and after seeing this they felt sorry on behalf of the people of the Israeli army.

Mr. Argan said, ""I feel that the guilt you may be resolved to such words for a higher and they voice to the people, but you were killed in the children and I am to remember the beach near the killing.""
Shaimoon papers said that Israel is not the tragedy Gaza HAMAS, which has been set up there dangerous dictator.
Davies BBC correspondent says in the World Economic Forum in the first ever see the scene.
However, the erdgan made after the president said that he respects Israel, and also the of which they will yell, on his saying they were far away from truth
Turkey allowing them to visit Muslim countries and has established diplomatic relations with Israel, but tensions have grown in the last few years.

hl.seg: Financial crisis: German millionaire industrialist commits suicide.

doc.seg: Adolf Marclay, a resident of Swabia in south Germany has left behind a huge industrial company.
But he was not well known to German public until recently.
When he had to negotiate with 30 banks for weeks regarding his debts towards industrial companies, he became big news, and could see the dark future for the Marckay Group.
Marclay Group had to bear the loss of hundreds of millions of euros after it bought the shares from the known industry, Folks Wigan.
The financial institutes rejected to provide the much needed one billion euros to this group and this exerted severe pressure on Marclay.

Recently the same banks accepted to provide a loan to Marclay group on urgent basis. Adolf Marclay who started as a small industrialist, has industrial group's annual income reached 30 billion euros, couldn't bear the the loss in his financial strength.
After the death of his father, Adolf Marclay took the responsibility of the business. He used modern methods to make his business more successful.
He named his company Ratiopharm which is now Germany's most successful and biggest pharmaceutical company.

Until recent times this pharmaceutical company had a budget of around 5 to 6 billion euros and is now earning around 8 billion euros annually. After the great success of Rasue farm the Marclay Group bought many big industries such as Hi-Del Barag Cement, a manufacturer of construction equipment as well as Kassbohrer, a good car maker.
Marclay Group has a employee number of around 100 thousand around the world and among its industries, Rasue Farm has always been given special importance.
Adolf Marclay has said this many times in his life. """"We have been in pharma business since four generations"""".
Now the industry is handled by his children and I hope that it continues to progress for a few hundred years by our family.

After the suicide of Adolf Marclay,the banks have given approval of temporary loan of 400 million euro for his group VEM, but on the condition that VEM has to be sold to Rasio Farm in order to improve the financial position of this group.
After the death of Adolf Marclay, the Marclay Group will not remain the same as it was before.

hl.seg: American President Obama is trying to take charge.

doc.seg: On the whole, Americans are different from most other people in the world.
Obama, becoming the President of United States of America, received messages of congratulations and is now in the range of expectation.
The German Chancellor, Angela Merkel , expressed his confidence on the new American president.
I believe that the relationship with the United States and the Federal Republic of Germany and Persia would solve many problems.
Russian Prime minister Mir Putin said that this serious and open heart is a good thing.
The policies of the former American president, George W. Bush faced criticism.

The Administration of the international level China praised the constructive role on the movement since, and the American President said that the two countries have to strengthen the military relations to work together.
Yak says that the German expert is active in city politics.
With this, I believe that the coming weeks and months will have strong pressure from the economic team to encourage the government of China to have better rate of exchange.
The relationship of India and Former US administration will be better.
The American studies professor in New Delhi, Raj, said that we are in a strategic partnership as long as one night does not bring a change.
Pope Benedict also gave a message in the name of peace to the world in the atmosphere of cooperation and stressed on developing.

hl.seg: U.S. Vice President Joe Biden arrived in Pakistan.

doc.seg: The foreign minister welcomed the U.S. Vice President.
The United States sent Vice President Joe Biden on a visit to Pakistan. On Friday the delegation arrived in Islamabad.
External Affairs Minister, Shah Mahmood Qureshi, and the American embassy officials welcomed him.
American Senator Lindsey Graham is also accompanying Biden.

Lew Fenter, Press Officer of the American Embassy, told Voice of America that the newly elected President will be discussing several regional affairs with the Pakistani Leadership during his tour, however, he refused to disclose any further details.
According to the Foreign Affairs Ministry, Joseph Biden will also be meeting with Army Chief General Ashfaq Pervez Kiani along with other high officials from the government.
It is hoped that in these meetings, other important bilateral and international affairs will be discussed as well as the war against terrorism.
Joseph Biden has been awarded the Hilal e Pakistan medal.
After arriving to Islamabad, Joseph Biden met with President Asif Ali Zardari.
During that meeting, the President awarded him the Hilal e Pakistan medal for his role in the establishment of closer ties between America and Pakistan.

It should be noted that Joseph Biden as Chairman of Foreign Affairs Committee of the American Senate along with Senator Richard Lugar presented a bill which proposed a three times increase in civilian aid for next five years to Pakistan, taking it to 5.7 billion dollars.

hl.seg: Quetta, DSP, including four police personnel were killed

doc.seg: The file photo
The Quetta saryab road, highway in firing by unknown persons DSP 'a deputy Superintendent including the police force police personnel.

On Wednesday morning in a jeep two DSP, a Sub-inspector and two constable of police training center was going on saryab road, near degree College on a motorcycle rider unknown attackers jeep police opened fire, sub-Inspector Mehdi and constable, were killed on the spot while one DSP Hasan Ali died after reaching the hospital died of severe injuries.
Hospital sources say that the severe injuries DSP Ghulam Mahmud critical condition and they also head bullets in his neck and began.
After the incident, police surrounded area so far in the responsibility of the incident will not accept any.

hl.seg: Political and security issues were discussed at the meeting in Raiwind between the Sharif brothers and the Federal Minister for Interior.

doc.seg: The meeting between the largest centrist opposition party and the ruling party in Punjab was held in Raiwind on Sunday. In attendance were Pakistan Muslim League leader Nawaz Sharif; Federal Minister for Interior Rehman Malik; and Chief Minister of Punjab Shahbaz Sharif.
Local media states Rehman Malik delivered a message from the leadership of Pakistan People's Party.

However, talking to journalists after the meeting, Rehman Malik did not mention any details about this matter, stating only that he came to talk about building consensus on political issues and to brief the PML(N)’s leadership on the aftermath of the Mumbai attacks.
Malik stated “I informed them about the steps which have been taken thus far.""
“Don’t forget that the major crackdown was done in Punjab by the Punjab government, and the team that I have formed now will also require help from the Punjab government.""

Rehman Malik said that the media is not briefed every day; however, messages are exchanged with PML(N)’s leadership on daily basis. Spokesman for the Pakistan Muslim League, Pervaiz Rasheed, also refrained from talking about any of the political issues, stating only that Rehman Malik had stated everything of importance.

It should be noted that the Interior Minister met with the Pakistan Muslim League’s leadership at the same time when twenty Nazims belonging to PML(Q), the opposition party in Punjab, held a press conference with Governor Salman Taseer. PML(N), while dismissing the objections of the Nazims against steps taken by the provincial government, objected to the involvement in this matter of the Punjab governor, a member of Pakistan Peoples Party.

p.seg: After the formation of Pakistan, the South was under Wali South, which had a single rule.

In the south, after the end of Wali South rule, no more schools were built.
They also showed no interest in their development.

In his book ""Main hoon Taymoor,"" Amir Taymoori writes, ""I realized in my life a secret that if the military commander of the military is in first row then that military would never loose.""
However, our situations here is different.
Their belief was that people are present only to die for us, and that dying thusly is pious.
However, if people die in this manner, then they have been murdered.
Panel of the People's Council stated that five terrorists have been named, including Jamate Alqaidas, Sayeed, and three Pakistani civilians.

Security council of Al-Qaida and Taliban committees have allowed the inclusion of these Pakistanis in the list of terrorists in this list: Jamaate Alkaidas, Amir Hafiz, Mohammed Sayeed, Adham Tanzim, Lashkare Tayibas, Chief Zaki Rhman Laqvi, Shohaib Waliyats, and master Haji Mohammed Ashraf are listed.
Apart from this, a Saudi civilian, Mahmood Ahmed Basik, is also listed in the terrorists' list.
The organizations Jamate Alqaida, Pashebaan Kashmir, and Al Rasheed Trust International are included.
By law all these organizations' and people property have been confiscated, they have been arrested, and they were banned from traveling.
They have to face the court's judgment.
Were these restrictions part of Indian propoganda?
Why is India blaming these organizations for attacks on Mumbai without any evidence?
Are there no terrorist organizations in India?
How the minorities are treated in India is not news to the world.
